title: How to Make a Tuna Burger

steps.headline: Beat the eggs and lemon juice.
steps.description: In a medium-size bowl, beat the eggs and lemon juice with a fork until the eggs break and the mixture is watery.

steps.headline: Add the cheese and breadcrumbs.
steps.description: Pour in the Parmesan cheese and breadcrumbs into the egg mixture. Mix with a spoon until the mixture resembles a pasta-like substance.

steps.headline: Add onions and tuna.
steps.description: Fold in the diced onion and tuna into the mixture. Stir well until mixture is creamy and slightly thick. Season with a desired amount black pepper. Mix.

steps.headline: Shape the tuna mixture into patties.
steps.description: Using your hands, pick a tablespoon amount of the tuna mixture and roll it out in a ball. Flatten it slightly to form a burger patty. Lay it on a tray. Repeat until there is no more tuna.

steps.headline: Have the burgers chill.
steps.description: Cover the tray with plastic wrap and place it in the fridge to chill. Have the burgers chill for about an hour, until they slightly thicken.

steps.headline: Preheat the stovetop.
steps.description: Put the stovetop onto medium heat and lay a frying pan or skillet on the heat. Sprinkle olive oil over the pan.

steps.headline: Fry the tuna burgers.
steps.description: Place the tuna burgers on the frying pan or skillet. Have them cook for about five minutes on both sides, making sure both sides are golden brown and crispy.

steps.headline: Place the tuna burgers on buns.
steps.description: Using a spatula, remove the tuna burgers from the heat. Place burgers on buns and add any desired toppings such as ketchup, mustard, ranch, lettuce, shredded carrots, chopped cucumbers, sliced avocado, and/or grilled onions.

steps.headline: Serve and enjoy!
steps.description: Place a tuna burger on a serving plate to eat. Serve with a glass of your favorite beverage if you want.
